signature: TransformedSortedMap<K, V> transformedSortedMap(SortedMap<K, V>, Transformer<? super K, ? extends K>, Transformer<? super V, ? extends V>)

enhanced_by.method_name: transformingSortedMap(SortedMap<K, V>, Transformer<? super K, ? extends K>, Transformer<? super V, ? extends V>)
enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require the same input parameters: a SortedMap and two Transformers.

enhanced_by.method_name: transformedMap(Map<K, V>, Transformer<? super K, ? extends K>, Transformer<? super V, ? extends V>)
enhanced_by.reason: Both methods involve transforming a map with key and value transformers.
The transformedSortedMap method uses transformMap to transform the existing contents of the map, making it a good candidate for assertions.
The transformedSortedMap method modifies the map, similar to the put method, which can be used to assert changes in the map's state.
